title: Peter Svensson
text:
Anders Peter Svensson is a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> record producer, songwriter, and musician. He is the main songwriter and guitarist of the band <a href="the%20Cardigans">the Cardigans</a>.
He started playing guitar at the age of eight, and in his teens he went on to play with local bands. After meeting bass player <a href="Magnus%20Sveningsson">Magnus Sveningsson</a>, they formed The Cardigans in 1992. Peter Svensson is credited with writing the music and melodies for almost all of the group's original songs.
In 1998, he released a side/solo project called <a href="Paus%20%28band%29">Paus</a>. All songs were co-written together with <a href="Joakim%20Berg">Joakim Berg</a> from the band <a href="Kent%20%28band%29">Kent</a>. The drums were played by The Cardigans' drummer <a href="Bengt%20Lagerberg">Bengt Lagerberg</a>.
In 1999, <a href="Paus%20%28album%29">the Paus album</a> and Svensson’s work on The Cardigans' fourth album, <a href="Gran%20Turismo%20%28album%29">Gran Turismo</a>, earned him a Swedish Grammy as Composer of the Year.
Svensson co-wrote (again with Joakim Berg) Swedish singer <a href="Titiyo">Titiyo</a>’s album, "Come Along".
The single, "<a href="Come%20Along%20%28Titiyo%20song%29">Come Along</a>", was a big hit in 2001 and was awarded a Grammy for Song of the Year in Sweden.
Since the last album with The Cardigans, <a href="Super%20Extra%20Gravity">Super Extra Gravity</a>, Svensson has written and produced songs for numerous international artists such as <a href="The%20Weeknd">The Weeknd</a>, <a href="Ariana%20Grande">Ariana Grande</a>, <a href="Ellie%20Goulding">Ellie Goulding</a> and <a href="One%20Direction">One Direction</a>.
